oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1948-07-24 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from July 7, 1948. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Red Foley (host, performer), Ernest Tubb (performer), Tommy 'Butterball' Paige (performer), Old Hickory Singers including Claude Sharpe (performers), Minnie Pearl (performer), Eggie McEwen (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet (performers), Floyd Ethridge (performer), and Milton Estes (performer). Part 1: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/633
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Old Hickory Singers; Ernest Tubb; Rod Brasfield; Wally Fowler; Oak Ridge Quartet; Red Foley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Red Foley introduces Ernest Tubb -- Forever Is Ending Today (Ernest Tubb) -- Red Foley introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield) -- Red Foley introduces Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet -- Ride On King Jesus (Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet) -- Blue Eyes Crying In The Rain (Red Foley) -- Leather Britches (Floyd Ethridge fiddle, Milton Estes calls) -- Closing statement (Red Foley) -- Announcer closing statement -- Shasta commercial -- Introduction of NBC special broadcast
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Paige, Tommy; Old Hickory Singers; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; McEwen, Eggie; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Boys; Ethridge, Floyd, 1908-1981; Estes, Milton, 1914-1963
